update.description:
Implement a test fixture [util.hh](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/new#chg-test/util.hh) which can be used by tests in order to start the log system using a name composed by: test_case + test_name. 

Use this fixture in all kind of unit tests. Some extra features were added to the Fixture, so [Console_TEST](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/update/939#chg-gazebo/common/Console_TEST.cc) can get rid of most of the duplicate code among test casese.

The final goal is to be able to export all log files in jenkins. An example of this working can be found in [this exportlog testing job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-exportlog-precise-amd64/14/).
update.title: Issue #1002. Use a Fixture to generate proper log filenames in tests

pull_request.title: Issue #1002. Use a Fixture to generate proper log filenames in tests

pullrequest.title: Issue #1002. Use a Fixture to generate proper log filenames in tests

content.raw: Thanks both for the fixes. Here we go.
content.html: Thanks both for the fixes. Here we go.

pull_request.title: Issue #1002. Use a Fixture to generate proper log filenames in tests

pullrequest.title: Issue #1002. Use a Fixture to generate proper log filenames in tests

content.html:
For example:

diff -r 4feb5ba568b5 test/util.hh
--- a/test/util.hh  Thu Jan 30 23:18:18 2014 -0800
+++ b/test/util.hh  Fri Jan 31 14:52:35 2014 -0800
@@ -38,7 +38,7 @@

               // We need to create the log directory if needed.
               boost::filesystem::path log_path(getenv("HOME"));
-              log_path = log_path / ".gazebo";
+              log_path = log_path / ".gazebo" / "test_log";
               if (!boost::filesystem::exists(log_path))
                 boost::filesystem::create_directories(log_path);

content.raw: This was removed as a re-implementation of the behaviour of gzInitLog when is called twice. In the new line 153, the check does not return but instead call delete on the buffer.
content.html: This was removed as a re-implementation of the behaviour of gzInitLog when is called twice. In the new line 153, the check does not return but instead call delete on the buffer.

content.raw: There is an autogenerated header file `gazebo/util/util.hh`. They're in different folders, so there's probaly no problem distinguishing between them, but I thought I'd mention it.
